elements.title: Statue of Industry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 80 police officers were needed to disperse a crowd that tarred and feathered Statue of Industry (pictured)?

elements.title: illegal coins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fridges filled with "frozen duck" sent to Britain actually contained illegal coins?

elements.title: Secret Empire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Steve Englehart wrote the Captain America comic book storyline "Secret Empire" as an allegory for the Watergate scandal?

elements.title: Uganda Muslim Supreme Council (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Uganda Muslim Supreme Council became the richest landlord in Uganda after inheriting land left behind by Asian Muslims expelled under Idi Amin?

elements.title: November 2013 North American storm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a downed power line caused a fire spanning more than 100 acres (40 ha) during a November 2013 North American storm?

elements.title: seasonal hyperacute panuveitis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that white moths are suspected to cause seasonal hyperacute panuveitis in Nepal?

elements.title: Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developers of Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number suggested that Australian customers pirate their game?

elements.title: National Stupid Day (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "National Stupid Day" was not intended to be on Veterans Day?
